intro: Ophiorrhiza chuniana, commonly known as the slender sandalwood, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a small shrub characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers and narrow, leathery leaves. Native to Southeast Asia, it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are often clustered in umbels. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an important component of tropical ecosystems.
